settings.title: Travellers' Diarrhoea
settings.subtitle: Travellers' diarrhoea is a disorder that affects the digestive tract. It usually occurs when you eat or drink something you are unfamiliar with. See our range of antidiarrheal medications below.

settings.title: Where can you get travellers' diarrhoea?
settings.text: Travellers' diarrhoea usually occurs when people travel to places that have different climates and sanitary practises. Places that affect people the most include Central and South America, the Middle East, Africa and most of Asia.

settings.title: How is travellers' diarrhoea treated?
settings.text: If you have a mild case of travellers' diarrhoea, it may resolve on its own after a few days of eating bland foods that you are already familiar with. Antidiarrhoeal medicines can stop you from needing to go to the toilet as often and can be very useful to have when travelling.

settings.title: of travellers may be affected by travellers' diarrhoea around the world
settings.text: According to Patient.info, it is estimated that 20-60% of travellers will be affected by travellers' diarrhoea.

settings.title: of travellers' diarrhoea cases are caused by bacteria
settings.text: According to NICE, bacteria are the most common cause of travellers' diarrhoea and are thought to account for 80-90% of cases.

settings.title: Buy travellers diarrhoea treatment online
settings.text: “Travellers' Diarrhoea is a common problem for travellers to developing countries. It is usually caused by eating contaminated food or drinking contaminated water. The best way to avoid Travellers' Diarrhoea is to be careful about what you eat and drink while you are travelling. If your symptoms are severe, or if you have bloody diarrhoea, it is important to see a doctor as soon as possible. These could be signs of a more serious infection, and you may need antibiotics to treat the infection!”

settings.title: How long after eating do you get travellers' diarrhoea?
settings.text: Symptoms will typically appear within 6-24 hours after an infection caused by bacteria or a virus.

settings.title: How long does travellers' diarrhoea last?
settings.text: The symptoms usually last between 3-5 days on average.

settings.title: What are the symptoms of travellers' diarrhoea?
settings.text: Travellers' diarrhoea is defined as when you have 3 or more bouts of loose, watery poo in a 24 hour period.

settings.title: What can I do to avoid traveller's diarrhoea?
settings.text:
Keeping good hygiene is an important way of avoiding travellers' diarrhoea. Other ways of avoiding it include:

Drinking bottled water instead of water from the tap
Using bottled water when brushing your teeth

Avoiding ice in your drinks

Trying not to swallow water when swimming

Washing hands with soap before every meal

Make sure your food has been thoroughly cooked

Avoid foods that may contain uncooked eggs

Avoid fruits and vegetables with damaged skin.
